titles.title: To amend title 39, United States Code, to allow absentee ballots in Federal elections to be mailed by voters free of postage.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E957)
Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Workforce, Post Office, and the District of Columbia.

bill.summary:
5/3/2007--Introduced.
Allows absentee ballots in federal elections to be mailed free of postage, except for any mail matter transmitted under the provisions of the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act.
